results.title: The Watchers
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Cath Moore, Joe Weatherstone and Steven McGregor
results.brief_description: In a world where all our desires are monitored, a teenage boy is inspired to cross the line. But The Watchers are out and they show him where his actions may lead. Cast: Wayne Pygram, Dane Sheddon, Nathaniel Dean, Wayne Blair. 35mm live action footage with digital effects created on SGI, Mac and PC. Original format 35 mm/colour.

results.title: The Moment
results.creator_credit: Apid Busayasiri and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A young man goes to visit the grave of his grandmother at a remote graveyard on the outskirts of a city. While he is there a series of mysterious events unfold that magically transport him back to his joyful childhood. Hand drawn animation.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Fluid
results.creator_credit: Lachlan Dean and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
An animated ink blot transverses the treacherous terrain contained within a sketchbook of ideas as scarey doodles attack it from every side.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Egg
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Anne Gilhooly and Nicole Mitchell
results.brief_description:
An elderly woman living alone in her suburban family home makes a friend - a fallen bird’s egg she finds in the local park. She takes Egg into her home, and into her heart.
A sensual and evocative film about lonliness, life and love.
Features Paulette Perry as the woman.

results.title: Nigel & Frank meet their matchbox
results.creator_credit: Sam Howie and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A light-hearted animated story of friendship and just how far two old mates will let greed and envy come between them when they discover a magic matchbox. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Blue Tongue
results.creator_credit: VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne, Timothy Jolley and Justin Kurzel
results.brief_description:
On the fringes of a housing estate a girl seduces a boy with a secret she will only reveal in exchange for his love. When the boy fails to honour the pact, what he holds close is threatened by the girl’s desire for revenge. Cast: Arlan Fahey Leigh and Siana Smit.
In 2005 ‘Blue Tongue’ was the first Australian short film to be selected for screening at the International Critics Week at the Cannes International Film Festival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne, Timothy Jolley and Justin Kurzel

results.title: Night's High Noon: an anti-terrain
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Created amidst Australia’s 1988 Bicentenary celebrations, ‘Night’s High Noon’ proposed a flipside to stereotyped notions of recent Australian history and identity. For Australia’s Aboriginal peoples the Bicentenary represented 200 years of dispossession from their land, cultural destruction and racial prejudice. Representations of indigenous cultures allude to the appropriation and objectification of Aboriginal peoples, their artforms and traditions, in white Australian popular culture. Truth and Meaning are similarly problematised.

Produced with the assistance of the Australian Film Commission.
Notes by Rachel Kent, reprinted courtesy of the author and d/Lux Media Arts.

results.title: Singing Stone
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
A hand clutches an oval stone which is drawn back and forth in tight circular motions, grinding pigment. Produced with a black and white half inch reel-to-reel portapak video recorder (manufactured c1975). ‘Singing Stone’ demonstrates Callas’ early experimentation with colouriser painting techniques. The effect is one of visual distortion in which pictorial surface and depth oscillate, creating a sense of dislocation and hallucination.
Notes by Rachel Kent, reprinted courtesy of the author and d/Lux Media Arts.
